trans-unit.source: Validate your MAM setup | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Validate your MAM setup | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: This topics describes how you can test and validate if your MAM policy is set up correctly and working as expected.
trans-unit.target: This topics describes how you can test and validate if your MAM policy is set up correctly and working as expected.

trans-unit.source: Validating your mobile application management setup
trans-unit.target: Validating your mobile application management setup

trans-unit.source: This topic provides information on checking for issues after you set up mobile application management (MAM).
trans-unit.target: This topic provides information on checking for issues after you set up mobile application management (MAM).

trans-unit.source: This guidance applies to MAM policies in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: This guidance applies to MAM policies in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: Checking for symptoms
trans-unit.target: Checking for symptoms

trans-unit.source: Users are unlikely to report issues since MAM is a data protection tool.
trans-unit.target: Users are unlikely to report issues since MAM is a data protection tool.

trans-unit.source: If there is a problem with the MAM configuration the user will have unrestricted access, as they would have without MAM, and would not be aware that there is an issue.
trans-unit.target: If there is a problem with the MAM configuration the user will have unrestricted access, as they would have without MAM, and would not be aware that there is an issue.

trans-unit.source: For this reason we recommend that you validate your MAM configuration by piloting your MAM policies with a small group of users who can deliberately test the MAM restrictions.
trans-unit.target: For this reason we recommend that you validate your MAM configuration by piloting your MAM policies with a small group of users who can deliberately test the MAM restrictions.

trans-unit.source: What to check
trans-unit.target: What to check

trans-unit.source: If testing shows that your MAM policy behavior is not as anticipated, we recommend that you check the following:
trans-unit.target: If testing shows that your MAM policy behavior is not as anticipated, we recommend that you check the following:

trans-unit.source: Are the users licensed for MAM?
trans-unit.target: Are the users licensed for MAM?

trans-unit.source: Are the users licensed for O365?
trans-unit.target: Are the users licensed for O365?

trans-unit.source: The status of each of the users' MAM apps.
trans-unit.target: The status of each of the users' MAM apps.

trans-unit.source: The possible statuses for the apps are **Checked in** and **Not checked in**.
trans-unit.target: The possible statuses for the apps are **Checked in** and **Not checked in**.

trans-unit.source: User MAM status
trans-unit.target: User MAM status

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal choose **Intune mobile application management** > **settings** > **app management** > **All settings** > **App reporting by user** > **users**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal choose **Intune mobile application management** > **settings** > **app management** > **All settings** > **App reporting by user** > **users**.

trans-unit.source: Choose a user from the list or search for and choose a user, then choose **Select user**.
trans-unit.target: Choose a user from the list or search for and choose a user, then choose **Select user**.

trans-unit.source: At the top of the **App reporting** column you will see whether the user is licensed for MAM.
trans-unit.target: At the top of the **App reporting** column you will see whether the user is licensed for MAM.

trans-unit.source: Below that you will see whether the user is licensed for O365 and the app status for all of the user's devices.
trans-unit.target: Below that you will see whether the user is licensed for O365 and the app status for all of the user's devices.

trans-unit.source: App statuts for MAM
trans-unit.target: App statuts for MAM

trans-unit.source: What to do
trans-unit.target: What to do

trans-unit.source: Here are the actions to take based on the user status:
trans-unit.target: Here are the actions to take based on the user status:

trans-unit.source: If the user is not licensed for MAM, assign an Intune license to the user as described in [Manage Intune licenses](..\get-started\start-with-a-paid-subscription-to-microsoft-intune).
trans-unit.target: If the user is not licensed for MAM, assign an Intune license to the user as described in [Manage Intune licenses](..\get-started\start-with-a-paid-subscription-to-microsoft-intune).

trans-unit.source: If the user is not licensed for O365 obtain a license for the user.
trans-unit.target: If the user is not licensed for O365 obtain a license for the user.

trans-unit.source: If a user's app is listed as **Not checked in**, check if you've correctly configured a MAM policy for that app.
trans-unit.target: If a user's app is listed as **Not checked in**, check if you've correctly configured a MAM policy for that app.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that these conditions are applied across all users to which you want MAM policies to apply.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that these conditions are applied across all users to which you want MAM policies to apply.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: Get ready to configure mobile app management policies with Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Get ready to configure mobile app management policies with Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Protect app data using mobile app management policies with Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Protect app data using mobile app management policies with Microsoft Intune
